you'd only need a gui to edit the config: do you have a windows ssh client? (not sure if putty does sftp)
in ubuntu, try 'ssh localhost', if you can log in, ssh is running :-)
if ssh is running, an sftp client should work w/o changing your current setup
er, ah, I meant anything that looks like this: "tcp        0      0 :::22                       :::*                        LISTEN"
actually I should have said '... | grep 22 | grep LISTEN' :-)
a remote desktop might get you clipboard sharing, probably not file sharing :-)
meanwhile, if you can't ssh to yourself that probably needs to be fixed first/also :-) (my guess is sshd isn't running)
or, why bother, just set your firewall to only accept to port 22 from your VM
that's how my home box is set up, port 22 connect only allowed from the LAN or the IP's my work owns (so I can connect from work)
